studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added benefits/risks evaluation and updated study procedures regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.
Introduced off-site phone visit options for subjects on stable single-agent therapy.
Modified tumor assessment schedule and central review requirements.
Discontinued IDMC reviews following primary analysis.
Reclassified Duration of Response (DOR) from secondary to tertiary endpoint.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To address the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and allow for procedure modifications like local labs and drug shipment.
To add flexibility for subjects on study long-term while maintaining safety monitoring.
Sponsor was unblinded at the time of primary analysis (03 June 2019).
To follow standard of care for patients with disease control and limit cumulative radiation exposure.
To clarify the time period of reporting for specific adverse events of special interest with delayed onset.

studyChanges.afterText: every 12 weeks from last scan (not to exceed 24 weeks per investigator discretion)
studyChanges.summary: Updated tumor assessment schedule interval for subjects with durable disease control.
Changed Duration of Response (DOR) endpoint classification to align with Statistical Analysis Plan.

studyChanges.afterText: reporting of myelodysplastic syndrome, acute myeloid leukemia, or any secondary primary malignancy
studyChanges.summary: Added specific reporting requirements for AESIs with potential delayed onset.

studyChanges.beforeText: Blinded/Unblinded TA MD and study teams
studyChanges.summary: Removed references to separate blinded/unblinded sponsor teams following primary analysis unblinding.

studyChanges.afterText: additional OS analyses before the final OS analysis, if needed
studyChanges.summary: Clarified timing and conduct of additional interim survival analyses if requested by regulatory agencies.
